properties.name: Allenby Bridge
properties.comment:
Only pedestrians (and bicycles) are allowed to cross, no motor vehicles.
If you'd like to visit Israel from Jordan, this is worth knowing:
This border is controlled by the Israelis, but they stamp you on a separate piece of paper, and on the Syrian side they don't stamp you out, so if you come back to Syria using this same border post, there will be no trace of your visit to Israel in your passport (which is important for some countries such as Iran or Sudan).
Note: UAE demands 125 AED to stamp the carnet, all other border posts between Oman and UAE are free.
properties.name: Hatta-Al Wajajajh
Taba
properties.comment:
No guarantee you can pass. Sinai has been closed for a long time. 
Note: motorbikes are forbidden in Sinai.
Gives acces to Nakchivan enclave. Azerbaijan has closed its land borders since COVID.
properties.name: Sadarak/Dilicu
Sarfayt
properties.comment: You need a Yemeni visa to get through, which is normally only given to tourists heading to Soccotra.

properties.name: Wagah - Attari
properties.comment:
Single border crossing between Pakistan and India.
It's been closed since the 2025 air war between both countries.

properties.name: Psou
properties.comment:
It feels like a normal border crossing. Coming from Russia, you need the proper visa (see country info).
If you enter Abkhazia here, you must also exit from here, crossing from Russia to Abkhazia to Georgia isn't permitted.

properties.name: Bashmaq
properties.comment: On Iraqi side you arrive in Kurdistan. Visa on arrival is not possible, you need to have bought beforehand an e-visa for (federal) Iraq.

properties.name: Ibrahim Khalil
properties.comment:
Kurdish visa on arrival no longer available, you need to buy an e-visa online beforehand, either for Kurdistan only:
https://visit.gov.krd
or for Federal Iraq:
https://evisa.iq/en
Carnet isn't asked because it's possible to visit Kurdistan only without Carnet, if you exit using the same border. But if you wan to cross to Iran or Kuwait, you need to ask for your carnet to be stamped.

properties.name: Lipulekh
properties.comment: Only open for bilateral trade, no tourists allowed, except Indian pilgrims to Kailash, with special permit.

properties.name: Nathu La
properties.comment:
Generally closed, except for local traders and Indian pilgrims to the Kailash Mansarovar Yatra (special permit).
Indian tourists can drive up to the border, but foreigners can't.

properties.name: Purang
properties.comment: Open for bilateral trade, but also for Indian pilgrims doing the Kailash Mansarovar Yatra, with special permits needed.

properties.name: Khunjerab Pass
properties.comment:
Note to cyclists: it's forbidden to ride between Sost and Tashkurgan; you need to take a bus instead, and put the bike on the bus. Motorcycles and cars are OK.
You need to to pay 30$ pp on Pakistani side for the entrance into Khunjerab National Park.

properties.name: Rasuwagadhi-Gyirong
properties.comment:
Temporary closed in 2025 when the road was destroyed. Meanwhile the Kodari border post has been reactivated.
After it's fixed, it will again be the only crossing between Tibet and Nepal for tourists.

properties.name: Dibba
properties.comment: Just a police checkpoint, no immigration facilities, so open only to Omani and Emirati.

properties.name: Inguri
properties.comment:
It used to be possible to cross from Georgia to Abkhazia with the right Abkhazia visa, but it seems nobody has been able to cross for a long time.
Coming from Georgia, you're supposed to return to Georgia using the same crossing after your visit to Abkhazia (not continue into Russia).

properties.name: Nizhneleninskoye/Tongjiang
properties.comment: Ferry terminal.

properties.name: Blagoveschensk/Heihe
properties.comment: Ferry terminal

properties.name: Amurzet/Lobei
properties.comment: Ferry terminal.

properties.name: Shipki La
properties.comment: Only open for bilateral trade, no tourists allowed.

properties.name: Al Juddayyidah
properties.comment: Close to tourists. Only open for Iraqi pilgrims heading to Mecca.

properties.name: Kodari
properties.comment:
Border post linking Tatopani and Zhangmu on the Araniko highway. It had been the only crossing from Nepal to Tibet from the 1960s until the large earthquake of 2015 destroyed it. From then on, the Rasuwagadhi-Gyirong border took over.
The Kodari border post is normally closed, but it was reopened after the Gyirong road was destroyed (2025 monsoon season).
So it's expected that it will be closed down again after the Gyirong crossing is accessible again.

properties.name: Moreh
properties.comment: Closed since the military takeover in Myanmar.

properties.name: Khosravi
properties.comment: Only on foot, no motor vehicles allowed.

properties.name: Korala
properties.comment: This crossing is only open for trade between the 2 countries.

properties.name: Panitanki/Kakarbhitta
properties.comment:
As a tourist, you need to look for the immigration offices on either sides of the border, because 99.99% of the traffic is bilateral and they only need to show an ID to cross, so this is very unformal.
Have your visa checked and carnet stamped before crossing actual border, where they'll only check for your entry/exit stamps.
Note that the large 2-lanes highway is restricted to cars and trucks, motorcycles need to take the smaller road that runs parallel and which is congested with rickshaws.
